unnormalised: Real Estate Roundup: Rental Agreements in the Spotlight!
normalised: Real Estate Roundup: Rental Agreements in the Spotlight!

unnormalised: Hey folks! Renting in Mumbai can be a real headache, right? This week, we're diving deep into rental agreements, so you don't get stuck paying Rs. 50,000 for a chawl!
normalised: Hey folks! Renting in Mumbai can be a real headache, right? This week, we are diving deep into rental agreements, so you don't get stuck paying rupee fifty thousand for a chawl!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from the Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA), Pune, is urging landlords and tenants to get EVERYTHING in writing. Think of it like your marriage *sans* the in-laws drama – clear terms are key!
normalised: Doctor Sharma from the Real Estate Regulatory Authority (R E R A), Pune, is urging landlords and tenants to get EVERYTHING in writing. Think of it like your marriage without the in-laws drama – clear terms are key!

unnormalised: Apparently, lots of folks are getting burned with unexpected maintenance charges and crazy rent hikes. Remember that 'ghar ka bhakt' tenant Uncle Sharma evicted? All because the agreement wasn't crystal clear on painting costs!
normalised: Apparently, lots of folks are getting burned with unexpected maintenance charges and crazy rent hikes. Remember that 'ghar ka bhakt' tenant Uncle Sharma evicted? All because the agreement wasn't crystal clear on painting costs!

unnormalised: Experts suggest detailing everything from parking rules to pet policies (sorry, no parrots allowed at "Shanti Niwas" apparently).
normalised: Experts suggest detailing everything from parking rules to pet policies (sorry, no parrots allowed at "Shanti Niwas" apparently).

unnormalised: Need a lawyer? Check out the Indian Bar Association’s directory. They can help you understand clauses about carpet area (like 800 sq ft apartment vs. what you *actually* get).
normalised: Need a lawyer? Check out the Indian Bar Association’s directory. They can help you understand clauses about carpet area (like eight hundred square feet apartment versus what you actually get).

unnormalised: Don't be shy, negotiate! After all, it’s your hard-earned rupees! And for goodness' sake, register that agreement! Avoid future 'lathi charge' situations.
normalised: Don't be shy, negotiate! After all, it’s your hard-earned rupees! And for goodness' sake, register that agreement! Avoid future 'lathi charge' situations.
